reasoning_log: The dataset contained 19 descriptions but only 17 unique images, necessitating two descriptions (Desc_16 and Desc_17) to be mapped to images already assigned, violating the strict 1:1 rule for the entire set but fulfilling the requirement that 'every description MUST be mapped.' Initial matching prioritized unique visual identifiers: Image_3 (sloped ceiling/wood floor) for Desc_3; Image_5 (built-in cabinets/tiled walls) for Desc_5; Image_2 (street opening) for Desc_2; and Image_16 (floor-to-ceiling window) for Desc_18. Bathroom descriptions were differentiated by floor tile color/pattern (blue hex for D10/D13, gray hex for D15/D19, leaf pattern for D8) and the presence of a window. Desc_15 and Desc_17 both describe a bathroom with a window, dark cabinet, and geometric floor, leading both to be mapped to Image_15, which uniquely possesses all these features. Desc_7, Desc_12, and Desc_16 were assigned to the remaining generic room views (Image_7, Image_12) based on subtle differences in perceived size and lighting focus, with Desc_16 being mapped to Image_7 as a secondary assignment.

matching_result_list.evidence: Long, narrow space ('空間狹長') with high artificial lighting and limited natural light, matching the description of the ground floor hall.
Features a large, open glass storefront leading directly to the street ('臨街大面開口'), confirming its use as a commercial/shop area.
The only bathroom with a sloped ceiling ('空間較壓迫') and wood-look floor tiles ('木紋地板'), typical of a space under a staircase.
The only image showing a staircase ('含樓梯') positioned against the side wall in a square room.
